amendment.description: An amendment numbered 38 printed in the Congressional Record to provide $593 million for Section 8 incremental vouchers to remain available until expended, provided that $66 million of that amount is available for use in a housing production program in connection with the low-income housing tax credit program to assist very low-income and extremely low-income families.

action.text: Mr. Walsh raised a point of order against the Mollohan amendment (A006). Mr. Walsh stated that the amendment sought to increase funds without corresponding offsets and also that the amendment sought to appropriate funds not previously authorized and as such, consitituted legislation in an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
